pandas.replace_code:
def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    group_axis = obj._get_axis(axis)

    if axis == 1 and isinstance(key, str):
        key = [key]  # Convert single column name to a list

    if key is not None:
        if isinstance(key, (str, list)):
            keys = key if isinstance(key, list) else [key]
            match_axis_length = len(keys) == len(group_axis)
            levels = level if isinstance(level, (tuple, list)) else [level] * len(keys)

            if all(n in obj.columns or n in obj.index.names for n in keys):  # Check if all keys are in columns or index names
                groupings = [Grouping(group_axis, keys[i], obj=obj, level=levels[i], sort=sort, observed=observed) for i in range(len(keys))]
                return BaseGrouper(group_axis, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated), [], obj
